benchmark_details.name: MedHallu
benchmark_details.overview: A comprehensive benchmark designed for detecting medical hallucinations in Large Language Models (LLMs). The dataset comprises 10,000 high-quality question-answer pairs derived from PubMedQA, systematically categorized into easy, medium, and hard detection tiers based on the subtlety of hallucinations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a structured evaluation resource for the detection of medical hallucinations in LLMs.
tasks: Model benchmarking for AI safety in healthcare

data.annotation: Annotated to distinguish accurate responses from hallucinated content.

methodology.calculation: F1 score calculated based on true positive, false positive, and false negative values.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better hallucination detection performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Best model achieved F1 score of 0.625 for 'hard' hallucination detection.
methodology.validation: Validation performed using a multi-model ensemble approach.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data uses de-identified biomedical literature.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Utilizes publicly available PubMedQA data under MIT licenses.
